title: Implement Easy Login System with Prominent UI Elements

requirements.summary: Add a prominent login button to the main application interface that triggers Internet Identity authentication
acceptanceCriteria: Login button is prominently visible on the main application interface
Clicking the login button initiates the Internet Identity authentication flow
Button uses clear, user-friendly text like 'Login' or 'Sign In'
Button styling is consistent with the Betika green theme

file_operations.description: Create a reusable LoginButton component that integrates with the existing useInternetIdentity hook. The component displays 'Login' when logged out, 'Logout' when logged in, and shows loading state during authentication. Apply Betika green theme styling consistent with the brand colors defined in tailwind.config.js. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add the LoginButton component to the application header/navigation area to make it prominently visible on all pages. Position it in a consistent location that is easily discoverable by users. Ensure the button is rendered outside the router content so it appears on all routes.

requirements.summary: Update AccessDeniedScreen to provide a streamlined login experience with clear call-to-action messaging
acceptanceCriteria: Login prompt uses simple, encouraging language that explains the benefit of logging in
Internet Identity login button is large, clearly visible, and easy to click
Screen design is clean and focused on the login action without unnecessary clutter

file_operations.description: Redesign the AccessDeniedScreen component with a streamlined, user-friendly layout. Replace technical language with simple, encouraging messaging that explains why logging in is beneficial. Make the Internet Identity login button larger and more prominent with clear call-to-action text. Remove unnecessary clutter and focus the design on the primary login action. Apply Betika green theme styling for consistency.

requirements.summary: Add persistent login state indication showing user identity information in the application header
acceptanceCriteria: Logged-in users can see their authentication status in the application interface
User identity information or user menu is displayed in a consistent location (e.g., application header)
Login state persists across page refreshes using the existing useInternetIdentity hook

file_operations.description: Create a UserMenu component that displays when a user is logged in. The component should show the user's name from their profile (retrieved via getCallerUserProfile) instead of their principal ID. Include a dropdown or menu with user options. Use the existing useInternetIdentity hook to access identity state, which already persists across page refreshes. Style consistently with the Betika green theme. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions before implementing.

Integrate the UserMenu component into the application header alongside the LoginButton. Display the UserMenu when the user is authenticated and the LoginButton when they are not. Ensure the header layout accommodates both components appropriately and maintains visual consistency across authentication states.

requirements.summary: Add an easily accessible logout option for logged-in users
acceptanceCriteria: Logout button or option is visible and accessible to logged-in users
Clicking logout successfully terminates the Internet Identity session
After logout, the application returns to a logged-out state with login options visible

file_operations.description: Add a logout option within the UserMenu component. When clicked, call the clear() method from useInternetIdentity to terminate the session and clear the QueryClient cache to remove all cached application data including the user profile. Ensure the logout action transitions the UI back to the logged-out state where login options are visible. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions before implementing.

Ensure the LoginButton component properly handles the logout flow by calling clear() and clearing the QueryClient cache when in the logged-in state. This provides an additional accessible logout option for users who may not interact with the UserMenu. Verify the authorization component's usage instructions before implementing.
